title: Andre Onana not convinced hell still be a Man Utd player next season
body_text:
Andre Onana has cast major doubt on his Manchester United future, admitting he ‘doesn’t know’ if he will still be at the club next season.
The Cameroon international endured another unconvincing season at Old Trafford marked by a series of high-profile errors that have sparked suggestions his days at Old Trafford could be numbered.
Reports have suggested Ruben Amorim is open to replacing the former Inter Milan star this summer with Saudi Arabian clubs interested in offering him a route out of Manchester.
United have been linked with possible replacements in Eintracht Frankfurt’s Kaua Santos while recent reports have suggested Aston Villa’s Emiliano Martinez is eager to join the club.
Onana appeared at an event in Burkina Faso where he was quizzed on his future by journalist Stéphane Bassalia Ouattara.
‘”Will I leave? I don’t know, we’ll see!’ Onana said, Actu Cameroun report.
Onana was signed by United in 2023 for a fee of £47million to serve as the long-term replacement for David de Gea.

While he has produced some stunning stops during his time in Manchester, twice shortlisted for the Premier League Save of the Season in the 2024-25 campaign, his efforts have often been undermined by inexplicable errors.
Onana made a number of glaring mistakes in United’s doomed Champions League campaign during his first season at the club.
Mistakes against Viktoria Plzen, Brighton, Nottingham Forest and Ipswich further undermined his position last term, also at fault for both goals in United’s 2-2 draw with Lyon in their run to the Europa League final.
Onana’s high-risk playing style is often criticised but the goalkeeper has remained defiant over his abilities and approach.
Onana also clashed with former United midfielder Nemanja Matic after commenting United are ‘way better’ than Lyon heading into their Europa League game – comments that saw the label him ‘the worst goalkeeper in the club’s history’.

I don’t know to say that you need to have cover for something like that,’ said the former United and Chelsea midfielder when asked for his assessment of Onana’s bold statement. ‘I respect everyone then you need to give the answer.
‘If you are one of the worst goalkeepers in Man United history then you need to take care what you are talking about.
‘If David de Gea, or Van der Saar or Peter Schmeichel say that then I would question that.
‘But if you are statistically one of the worst goalkeepers in Man United’s history then he needs to show that before he says it. We will see.’
